attributes.action: Cheap migrant labour, humiliation in media/cyberspace, blackmailing, caste discrimination is a form of modern day ‘slavery’ should be abolished
attributes.additional_details: 'Slavery' in one form or another occurs all the time in societies, even today but by a different name. Even in marriage & employment, 'slavery' can sometimes occur. HMG should take seriously modern day ‘slavery’, like child slavery, people trafficking for sex/employment, abusive marriage partner or employer, bullying, humiliation in media/cyberspace, blackmailing, caste/social class discrimination, deception, abuse, physical aggression, humiliation, forcing a person to perform acts he/she does not will wish to do. Slavery occurs even for whites in Victorian Britain, not only slavery of blacks & others in various parts of the world. Employing cheap migrant labour (legally on work permits or otherwise) can be also a form of ‘slavery’, as well as jeopardising the identity and racial harmony of a country. Equal pay for work of equal value is a good concept, introduced by European Law, but the relative value of completely different kinds of work can be blurred & ambiguous.
